scenario_text.value:
(Following the monsters that attacked us, we
finally found what seems like a hideout.)
What is this place?

It’s like where you’d expect to talk to the
king in some fantasy RPG.
Yeah, you think that’s an actual throne?

That’s the word for where a king or queen
sits, right?

How can you be talking definitions right now?
There could be an evil queen here somewhere!
More importantly, we still haven’t found Miu!

Miu! Where are you?! I know you’re here
somewhere!

Hey, Kaito! Cut it out! Keep yelling like
that, and the queen’s sure to find us!
What’s going on? Who’s making all that noise?
That voice...!

Huh?! Is that who I think it is up on that
throne?
I thought so.
Wait, Miu was the queen?!
Whoa! No way!
I... I had no idea.
Well, who else would it be?
Yeah, I had my suspicions too.

So did I. I thought it might be her once we
heard the queen was a little girl.

Yes, though I found that somewhat hard to
believe until I had seen it for myself.
You mean you all knew?!
Of course! I got it right from the start!
Nah, I’m not buying that from you, Dracumon.

Well, now we can be sure the queen isn’t some
horrible monster. That’s the important thing.
(I don’t think Shuuji had any idea either.)
Hey! What are you all doing barging in here?

Miu! I finally found you! And you’re all
right!
Oh, I’m so glad. I’m so glad you’re not hurt.

(Kaito has tears in his eyes. Exactly what
you’d expect out of a touching reunion.)
(No doubt Miu is glad to see him t—)
Ugh. Shut up!
Huh?

This is the worst! Did you chase me all the
way here?

You know I did. Now come on, it’s not safe
for you to be out here on your own.
I’m not on my own! I’ve got everyone here!
Everyone here? What do you mean?

Are you talking about all those little
guys?

Well, they did say they were servants of the
queen.

That’s right! They’re all my servants! Oh,
except for Shakomon. She’s my best friend!
Ser...vants...

Hey, I said Shakomon was different, didn’t I?
You tell them, Shakomon!
It’s a pleasure to meet you, Kaito.
An-another monster?!

Don’t you call her a monster! Shakomon’s the
only one who understands me!
That’s right, Miu!
So, you’re the one who put her up to this?

Shakomon’s not like that! I don’t believe
what I’m hearing!

You’re always like this! You act tough, pick
fights, won’t shut up, and are so annoying!
No, I just...

And anyway, I don’t want to be around those
strangers from some other school!
Uh, you mean us?

Figures. You can’t put kids from different
schools together and expect ’em to get along.

Uh-huh. You say that, but I don’t think you
really mean it. I mean, come on...
Oh, shut up.

Miu, you can trust Takuma and the others.
They’re actually really nice.

Now come on, I’ve been worried sick about
you. Stop goofing off, let’s get moving!

You being bratty about this is just making
things worse for everyone!

Ugh. Listen to you. You think you’re sooo
much better than me!
Well, I hate you, Kaito! So there!
Miu...

So much for the caring and supportive brother
and sister. These two are out of control.

Kaito’s always trying to act all cool, but
can’t keep it up in front of his sister, huh?

You never can tell what things are really
like between siblings.

(Strangely enough, out of everyone here,
Shuuji seems the most calm.)

(But I should be focused on what to do in
this situation.)

So, what do we do about this? It doesn’t seem
like Miu is going to just give in.
I was wondering the same thing.

And Kaito isn’t in much shape to help right
now.
She hates me... She said she hates me...
Kaito, really?

She dealt him one heck of a blow. Miu might
just be the strongest one here.
So, what are we going to do?

She’s still just a child. We should scold her
for acting out.

Without even listening to her side of things?
You’ll probably just make her more upset.

What concerns me most of all is Miu’s lack of
any sense of danger.

It’s kind of amazing she wasn’t scared on her
own, even with Shakomon and the others.

Maybe we should explain to her just how
dangerous this world can be.

But don’t you think it’d be faster to tempt
her with stuff? She’s still a kid, after all.

If Haru or Miyuki said we had toys and candy,
I bet she’d love it!

I don’t think so... I’d rather play with my
sister.
Play...
Oh, right, I forgot you two were like this.

Okay, enough whispering! It’s getting on my
nerves. Get out of here already!
Or else!

Uh, I’m not sure what she’s got planned, but
she’s up to something.
Takuma, what do we do?
(Whatever it is, we need to act fast!)

(Should we scold her, like Shuuji thought?
Emphasize the danger, like Aoi suggested?)

(Or should we take Minoru’s approach and try
appealing to her with something she’d want?)
(What can I say to persuade Miu?)
This world is dangerous.
Stop acting up!
We’ve got great food!
The world is dangerous.

Miu, you don’t seem to have realized it, but
this world is a very dangerous place.

So rather than stay here by yourself, why
don’t you come with us?

I said I’d be fine with Shakomon here, didn’t
I? Why aren’t you listening to me?
Are you making fun of Shakomon?!
That’s not what we’re doing at all.

We all have our own partners, like Labramon
here. We know just how helpful they can be.

Then you know I don’t need to go with my
brother or anyone else!

Even so, we should stick together! Being with
Shakomon doesn’t mean you’re not in danger!
I will protect Miu from any danger.

This is no use. They have no conception of
the true threats they face.
(How can we make them understand?)
Stop acting up!

Miu, stop acting up and being mean to Kaito!
He’s been worried sick about you!

Ugh, you sound just like my brother.
I hate it!

Hey! We’re older than you, and that makes it
our job to protect, care for, and guide you!

Oh, shut up! Just shut up about that! I hate
everyone who talks like my brother!

Ungh... She hates everyone who’s even like
me...
You sure have a soft spot for Miu, don’t you?

(It’s no use. If anything, this is only
making things worse.)
We’ve got great food!

Hey, if you come with us, we’ve got lots of
great food you could eat!

I don’t need your food! I’ve got lots of
sweets, and that’s enough for me!
Eating sweets all day is the best!
Miu! How is that healthy?

See? I knew you’d try to lecture me about
that! Well, nyaa, nyaa!

Oh, come on. Don’t you want some nice, warm
soup or a juicy piece of meat now and then?
Nice warm soup...and juicy pieces of meat?

That’s right! We may not have the best
ingredients, but Aoi’s cooking is delicious!

Well, I’d be happy to cook for you as best as
I can!

That does sound like...maybe it could be
nice.

Yes, I’ll use as many vegetables as possible
to make good, nourishing meals!

Bleh! Vegetables? No thanks! I’ll stick with
sweets!
Oh no...
Grr, what is with you and vegetables?
(Man, I feel like we almost had her, there!)

I’m so sick of this! I should’ve known my
brother and his friends would be annoying!
Sounds like she doesn’t like us at all.
Yeah, this could be bad.
So, what do we do, Miu?

Isn’t it obvious? My brother is always,
always worrying about me!

Well, I’ve had enough of it! I can take care
of myself! I’m gonna hit the switch!
No, wait! Miu, stop! This is your brother!
Don’t you think that’s going a little far?

Oh, it’s fine! It’s not gonna kill him or
anything!
Miu! What do you think you’re doing?!
Just something that’ll get you out of here!
All right, now, so long!
Wow, you really did it.
Did...what?
Huh? Wait... Wah!
Wh-what’s happening?
Miyuki! Hold on to me!

(The whole floor just tilted... Is this some
kind of trap door?!)
Uwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!
I’m falling!
